tool.name: Enrich

param.name: layer
param.dialogReference: Point, line, or polygon feature layer on which attributes will be calculated.
param.pythonReference: Point, line, or polygon feature layer on which attributes will be calculated.

param.name: polyconfigs
param.dialogReference: Existing enrichment configurations for the selected layer. Choose an existing configuration to update the properties or to delete the configuration. Choose 'Add New' to configure an additional enrichment layer.
param.pythonReference: Existing enrichment configurations for the selected layer. Choose an existing configuration to update the properties or to delete the configuration. Choose 'Add New' to configure an additional enrichment layer.

param.name: delete
param.displayname: Delete this enrichment configuration for this layer
param.dialogReference: When checked, the currently selected enrichment configuration will be deleted for the currently selected layer.
param.pythonReference: When checked, the currently selected enrichment configuration will be deleted for the currently selected layer.

param.name: polylayer
param.dialogReference: Polygon feature layer from which attributes will be copied.
param.pythonReference: Polygon feature layer from which attributes will be copied.

param.name: source
param.dialogReference: Field in the enrichment layer containing the value that will be copied to a field in the target layer.
param.pythonReference: Field in the enrichment layer containing the value that will be copied to a field in the target layer.

param.name: target
param.dialogReference: Field in the target layer that will be populated with the value from a field on the enrichment layer. Features already containing a value in this field will not be processed.
param.pythonReference: Field in the target layer that will be populated with the value from a field on the enrichment layer. Features already containing a value in this field will not be processed.

param.name: priority
param.dialogReference:
Enrichment configurations for a layer that have a lower priority value will override enrichment configuration with a higher value.

For example, if a layer has two enrichment configurations that both target the same field, and one has a priority value of 1 and one has a priority value of 2, the script will attempt to populate the field with a value from the configuration with priority 1, and if there is no value it will fall back to the configuration that has priority 2.
param.pythonReference:
Enrichment configurations for a layer that have a lower priority value will override enrichment configuration with a higher value.

For example, if a layer has two enrichment configurations that both target the same field, and one has a priority value of 1 and one has a priority value of 2, the script will attempt to populate the field with a value from the configuration with priority 1, and if there is no value it will fall back to the configuration that has priority 2.

tool.summary: Calculate attributes for new features based on the attributes of co-incident features.
tool.usage:
Use this tool to ensure complete attribution for new features by populating attribute values using values from co-incident features. For example, populate incoming Public Works service requests with the name and contact information of the local public works district based on the attributes of co-incident polygons representing those districts. This contact information can then be used to send an email to the person responsible for responding to the issue.

Many enrichment layers and fields can be configured for a single target layer by running the tol multiple times with the same input layer. Once a configuration has been created, it can be editied or deleted at any time by selecting the same input layer and choosing the correct configuration from the Enrichment Configurations list.
